overview: Canadian-specific regulations for selling soap and cosmetics, including CNF submission process and Health Canada requirements

cnf_basics.purpose: Notify Health Canada about your products and ingredients
cnf_basics.not_an_approval: CNF is NOT an approval procedure of your formula

key_principle.what_health_canada_checks: That you're not using banned, controlled, or prohibited ingredients

when_can_you_sell.if_theres_issue: Health Canada will contact you for clarification
when_can_you_sell.if_no_contact: You've done your part and you're good to go

quiz_questions.q: What is a CNF in Canadian soap selling?
quiz_questions.a: Cosmetic Notification Form - submitted to Health Canada to notify about products and ingredients
quiz_questions.explanation: It's a notification, not an approval process

quiz_questions.q: Can you sell soap in Canada immediately after submitting CNF?
quiz_questions.a: Yes - once CNF is submitted, you're good to sell
quiz_questions.explanation: Health Canada will contact you only if there's an issue

quiz_questions.q: Does Health Canada approve or disapprove your soap formula?
quiz_questions.a: No - they just check you're not using banned/controlled ingredients
quiz_questions.explanation: CNF is notification only, not approval

quiz_questions.q: What's the difference between Canada and UK soap selling rules?
quiz_questions.a: Canada allows immediate selling after CNF; UK may require waiting for approval
quiz_questions.explanation: Different countries have different regulatory approaches
